Government in Scotland is in four tiers.  A new

column2: following devolution of powers from the United Kingdom

column1: Parliament in London.  This is the first time Scotland has had its own
parliament in 300 years.  The Scottish Parliament
responsible for most aspects of Scottish life.  The national parliament in
Westminster (London) retains responsibility for areas such as defence
affairs and taxation.  The European Parliament in Brussels (Belgium) exercises
certain powers vested in the European Union.
